reviews.text: We just had one of the coolest Thai meals ever experienced in NYC. Not expecting much, we were tooling down 2nd Ave and suddenly there was this place with a herd of souls waiting for take out. Remembering the name from Beli, in we went and plonked au bar managed by a nifty slinger of drink. The chefâ€™s special was an ambrosial heap of seared beef raised to heavenly heights by  bouquets of mint, basil, tender salad fixings and a sublime bathing in a sauce that beggared description. The noods were a knock out, planetary pad Thai btw. Even more takeoutees were swarming when we left. Right you are if heading for Up Thai. You canâ€™t go wrong.
Loved it! And the our waitress was so sweet :)
Delicious food and very beautiful place. They have an option for lunch during week days that's very good price and you get to try very tasty dishes.

Food and service top notch.
Tried a delicious new Winter dish-Braised Pork Belly.

Fabulous cuisine.
Above & beyond service.
Bardzo sprawna obsÅ‚uga, potrawy podane szybko i zgodnie z Å¼yczeniem. Przepyszna kaczka, smaczny pad thai z krewetkami, woÅ‚owina teÅ¼ dobra. W sumie warto sprÃ³bowaÄ‡ smakÃ³w kuchni tajskiej
Food was so good. We got the kea mao and green curry, left super full

THE best Thai restaurant on the UES! Spring rolls, curries, soups, noodles, you canâ€™t go wrong with any dish here. Reservations can be hard to get, walk-ins may have a bit of a wait, but you wonâ€™t be disappointed!
Up Thai is a lovely restaurant that offers an extensive lunch menu. The service was great and the food was fresh and delicious.
Great thai option

My mother and I recently visited Up Thai and had a fantastic experience! The food was absolutely delicious â€” fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The service was quick, friendly, and attentive, and the cozy atmosphere made it a perfect spot for either lunch or a date night.

The only small downside was the clear plastic partitions between some of the tables â€” likely leftovers from COVID â€” but honestly, thatâ€™s just a minor detail in an otherwise outstanding dining experience.

Highly recommend this place if youâ€™re looking for amazing Thai food and great vibes!
Aoi was our waitress and she was excellent! Incredibly attentive and extremely knowledgeable of the full menu. We had the short rib special which was really great.

Pupee a Thai female receptionist/usherette gave me and gf a bar seat though we asked twice a table for two declining us with an attitude. We felt discriminated(weâ€™re Southeast Asian) as there were couple of unoccupied tables for two available. Three congenial Thai waitresses/waiter(one was Mimi) gave us readily a table for two(next to 2 white women) and served us pleasantly rectifying the situation.
Love, love this place. The servers are so friendly and the food. Omg. One of our party is celiac and they were so careful to make sure his food was perfect as well as safe. 10/10 recommendations!
Food is amazing but be prepared to wait over an hour for delivery. Like 1.5 hours.
We had 5 people. 3 dishes came out and the last 2 took another 15 minutes. Those last 2 were cold. They forgot to put in our dish orders.
Plenty of gluten free and celiac safe foods! Everything was delicious and it is a great atmosphere.
The entrees werenâ€™t hot when they got to the table. We ate them anyway. Food was delish!

The Kao Nar Gai lunch special ($18 plus tax) had tender white chicken which contrasted nicely with the crunch of the fresh vegetables. The set meal comes with your choice of an appetizer plus soup or salad. Skip the salad roll ($12). It tasted dry, even with the dipping sauce. The service is fast and efficient; Up Thai has a bigger wait staff than most comparably-sized restaurants.

I was hungry and was looking for lunch. Found this well rated restaurant on Google maps. Decided to give I a try. I didn't know they had a lunch special, and I had the salad and fried spring roll as an app and the tofu pad khing for lunch. The service was super friendly, the food came out really quick. I wasn't done with my app yet. It was delicious! I am definitely going again next time I'm in the neighborhood.

We absolutely loved our lunch at UpThai! Every dish we ordered was incredible! Fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The service was just as impressive-warm, attentive, and genuinely kind.

We were celebrating our twinsâ€™ birthday, and the staff surprised them by coming out to sing Happy Birthday with a delicious mango cheesecake and coconut ice cream. It was such a thoughtful touch and made the day extra special.

The atmosphere was cozy and vibrant, and everything from start to finish was excellent. Highly recommend UpThai, weâ€™ll definitely be back!
Best Thai on the upper east side by far! Amazing options and amazing service. Feels a tad rushed but overall, amazing restaurant.

Up Thai was some GREAT Thai food I've had since moving back to the area! My friends and I had some really lovely cocktails and their teas that are served with the pot is super comforting and very aromatic. The place is lovely but it's a little loud since they're so busy on a Saturday night, but that's certainly a good problem to have :)
That said, the service was... fine. But the reservation was in my name and as I was speaking to the hostess she did not look at me once and only looked at my friends. Our waiter was cool but he wouldn't let us keep the drink menu? They also apparently have a weird rule that you're only allowed two cups if you order the tea. We were a party of 3 and when I asked for another cup our waiter told us no. I totally respect businesses setting limits on sharing and stuff, but it was just treated really weirdly and made me feel guilty for even asking in the first place.

Went to this place for dinner with my little one. Since it was quite busy, we chose to sit outside. Everything was fine until a homeless man, seemingly struggling with mental health issues, started shouting and causing a disturbance nearby. He was loud and inappropriate, completely ruining the mood. We tried to finish our meal quickly and leave.
To add to that, I had ordered a whiskey on the rocks, but the bartender served it mixed with soda and waterâ€”and they refused to replace it.
The food itself was quite good, but overall, the experience was disappointing. Lesson learned: never sit outside in NYC.
Das beste Thai Restaurant in New York City. Ich gehe jedes mal dort Abendessen wenn ich in der Stadt bin. Man muss auf jedefall frÃ¼hzeitig reservieren. Mein Tipp: Die UP Rolls zur Vorspeise.

Went to have dinner for the first time here around 6:30pm. It was busy tonight but for a table of 2, we got seated in 15-20 mins. I ordered the Thai Wings for appetizer. I donâ€™t recommend because itâ€™s only fried wings with a side of chili wings. Nothing special about the wings so I was kind of disappointed. Honestly, the other food we got( tom yum, fish and pork belly) was alright. Got the pomelo salad which was my favorite. Got the Yuzu lemonade which has some kind of carbonation which was fine. The waitress name Jenn is great. Jenn was on top of everything including making sure our water was always filled which i appreciate so much! I like the restaurant due to the attentive staff and ambiance. In terms of food, I think it was alright. Our bill came out to be around $111 before tip.

I do want to mention, the hostess is in front of the restaurant. Tonight was pretty chilly and I feel bad for her. I hope she gets paid well enough cause being a hostess is not easy. The hostess did a very good job multi tasking as I was observing. It was very busy tonight. I saw a girl behind her, not sure what her role was but i thought she could have been doing more in helping the hostess or something. The hostess looks pretty stressed out lol

Place is small and homey. The food is so yummy and the drinks are so good! The staff were so kind in explaining everything and giving us recommendations. Getting seated without reservations is so quick and easy!
A peaceful environment and flavorful food â€” perfect combination.
Delicious food, great service, reasonable prices. Cocktails are good too. This place is a reliably good time and my go-to for Thai in Manhattan
So fresh, fast, affordable. When visiting NYC we eat here atleast 2X every trip
This was my first time dining here and everything was excellent. If you love Thai food youâ€™ll love it here.

The best Thai restaurant. Pad Thai, Pra ram, Steamed Branzino, crab rolls, Panang curry and desserts! This is a kids-friendly restaurant where you bring your family. Staffs are very nice. On Fridays, you see lots of people here for a date spit and drinks! Recommend to make a reservation.

After quite an exhaustive visit to The Met, decided to grab a late lunch at Up Thai. This was our first visit and we did not have a reservation, but we were lucky to get a table. The host and the place is warm and welcoming but what won us over were the cocktails and food.
One of the drinks, with a floating banana leaf and crispy Jasmine rice ball on the top was theatrical on the eyes as well as the pallette. Highly recommend going for the house special of the season.
The dessing on the beef salad was very well balanced. And I would have married the soft crab in the cocount curry if we had not scraped the bowl for the last drop of that flavorful curry.
The staff attended to us with utmost care and made the whole experience enjoyable. This is definitely worth a visit.

Great experience for rainy Sunday. Me and my friend went to this place and were surprised nice and quiet atmosphere, where different people can spend nice time and feel tet-a-tet even during â€œfull houseâ€. The food as always great (Tom Yam soup is my favorite dish for the cold season). The service was great as well. I forgot to tell a small nuance: reasonable prices.
Nice
Great Thai food
Really delicious, enjoyed myself.
We came for the curry and did not disappoint. Their comforting dishes proved Up Thai truly lives up to its reputation for exceptional Thai flavors.
The food was amazing and the service even better. The entire staff is friendly, accommodating, and very kind. Baby/stroller friendly as well. Highly recommend if you are in the area!
Best overall restaurant . 10 out of 10. Im regular . Love it there â¤ï¸
Everyday we come here to receive order for grubhub , but they donâ€™t allow us to use their restroom, They are so rude with us.
Good was amazingly delicious.

Up Thai is one of the best Thai spots around! The food is always fresh, flavorful, and beautifully plated â€” the pad kee mao and green curry are my go-tos. The place has a warm, stylish vibe, and the staff are super friendly and attentive. Great for both a casual meal or a nice dinner out. Always a great experience every time I go!

Life brings us to the City regularly lately, so we always try a new 'positive' before the trek home. Up Thai was a wonderful discovery! Happy, laid back atmosphere, coupled with pleasing, comfortable surroundings..and then there's the food. Fancy, delicious and memorable! Lucky us!!

Kwan provided great service! Food was excellent!
Super pyszne tajskie jedzenie w przyjemnej atmosferze.
What a great place, I came here to celebrate my anniversary after we finished chemo at MSK! And it felt so nice to be cared for!
WOW WOW WOW - die besten FrÃ¼hlingsrollen, die ich je gegessen habe. FÃ¼r New York ist Preis-Leistung echt top. Auch das rote Curry und der fritierte Reis sind sehr zu empfehlen.
The best Thai food in town. 5 stars.

After we got see around Metropolitan and Central Park on Sunday we had a lunch here. It's a wonderful place in NY, there are beautiful and kind servers, they are professional! Taste? That goes without saying! perfect! love hereâ™¡

Tip: On Sunday you can enjoy flea market and weekend street market just in front of Up Thai!

After you step into the door, you will meet Host is very kind and beautiful , smiling and friendly to you. Including the atmosphere of the restaurant is nice. In addition, the smiling staff Talking about the delicious food.So even though steamed Buns, Pork is dry and hard , i love Steamed Fish with ginger and scallions. But after Iâ€™m done,I would like to pack my food home ,I was waiting for the staff to help pack food for me is very long long time, no one paid attention to me. Even though there was a woman had a tattoo came to ask and help me bring my food to pack for me while the restaurant is not busy on that time. On the other hand, after my food arrived. my bill came quickly !!!, How ever all of the staff and manager was cute, smiling and good mood from the entrance of the restaurant.

Places was packed even at 4pm and rightfully so.

Went with some friends and tried four different dishes. I would recommend the place for sure.

Service was fast, food was plated well, portions were large for the price, and most importantly tasty.

I would definitely recommend trying the Thai iced tea lemonade, a wonderful flavor combination I havenâ€™t had before.

I will be back.

Another great Thai restaurant in NYC! The flavors werenâ€™t mind-blowing or life-changing, but everything was executed very well.

We got the mango avocado salad, the clay-pot fried rice, and the soft shell crab in red curry from the summer menu.

Our favorite was probably the mango avocado saladâ€”it had a perfect level of spice and acidity to complement the rest of the meal. The clay pot fried rice was a bit underwhelming for me. Although the blend of different types of meat offered great textures, the flavor was uniform throughout the entire dishâ€”everything tasted like sweet soy sauce or eel sauce. The soft shell crab curry was great and tasted just as expected.

The pad Thai and papaya salad we had were especially delicious â€“ highly recommended! If you go, try to sit inside; the interior ambiance is really nice and adds to the experience.
The only downside was that the restaurant handles a high volume of takeaway orders, which meant our food took over 30 minutes to arrive.

The best Thai spot! The food here was amazing, cannot recommend the panang curry with chicken enough. Also the Thai iced coffees were a hit. The restaurant was decorated beautifully and felt very cozy. Prices were super reasonable as well!

Kwan was an excellent server for us. All the food we ordered was excellent. The mousse cake was sweet but not too sweet with the icecream and mousse itself. The mango salad with fish was crispy. Basil chicken rice had a kick to it but not too spicy. Moo dang was a delicious dish.

I ordered three dishes for the table, including the Clay Pot rice, Pad Thai, and steamed mussels. Every dish was a hit. My favorite was the clay pot rice, a definite must have!!

The dishes tend to be sweet, but my mom felt it tasted too salty, so thereâ€™s definitely a cultural component to how you might perceive the food. When we arrived, it was starting to get busy (around ~5-5:30), so the workers started to set up a second location for dine in. My group of three ended up on one of the outside tables by this second location. I really appreciate Up Thaiâ€™s interior design so I was a little disappointed with not being able to show my family inside. Otherwise, dining outside went really smoothly. Servers paid thorough attention to customers outside, so I did not feel like we were lacking anything in comparison to sitting inside. In fact, one of the waiters reminded my family that Clay Pot rice was best enjoyed mixed, so they are pretty attentive to detail.

Where do I begin, I just happened to stumble upon this gem that has been here for 13years. The Menu is phenomenal, we had the short rib and soft shell crab on the summer special menu and everything was 10/10. The only thing I regret is not getting the mango salad branzino, but I will be back!! Thank you so much to Salina, for being so helpful with answering any questions we had and making wonderful recommendations! Salina really added to our overall positive experience! The chefs menu is also stellar. This is my new Thai go to spot, also affordablish prices!

Amazing food and great service!! Super worth it for the lunch specialsâ€” comes with salad/soup, appetizer & entree! HIGHLY RECOMMEND the duck, pad see ew and mango sticky rice (kinda pricey tho). Loved the decor inside, a little hot but food definitely hit the spot ğŸ˜‹

We made a reservation, and upon arrival, the host greeted us warmly with a lovely smile and seated us immediately. The atmosphere was beautiful, the decor was satisfying to look at, and the ambiance was wonderful as well.

It took our server a little while to greet us and bring water. He didnâ€™t say hello and went straight to taking our order. He wasnâ€™t rude, but a more welcoming approach would have made the experience better.

For appetizers, we had the duck roti roll and the calamari. The calamari was slightly overcooked, and the breading was falling apart â€” but the flavor was still great. We felt the duck roti roll had too much cucumber compared to the amount of duck, and the duck itself could have used a bit more seasoning.

For our entrÃ©es, we had the crispy duck Pad Thai from the lunch special, which was absolutely delicious. However, the dumpling that came with it lacked flavor and had a slightly mushy texture. We also tried the Pia Saam Ross (branzino with vegetables), which was phenomenal â€” flavorful, tangy, sweet, and spicy all at once.

The presentation of each dish was perfect â€” it looked like pure art. We were also very pleased with the service overall, especially since the staff kindly addressed an issue we had with one of our dishes.

Thank you so much â€” we will definitely be back again!
Our server Pat is super nice and thoughtful. Thank you for your awesome service! I had an amazing time with my family here. My favorite dishes are crispy branzino and mango sticky rice.

For good Thai food on the upper east side this is the spot. For friends or for date night this spot hits the criteria. Friendly staff large menu which includes alcohol, makes this a great spot for many occasion.

The food was great and the spice level actually hits normal standards not holding back at all. The papaya salad, green curry were great and the Branzino which was completed my deboned was also a hit with our group. The Thai tea is a bit o. The sweeter side but the tea flavors still came thru.

We had lunch here recently on a Saturday around noon. We were seated immediately. The place was nicely decorated. But the tables were a bit small and tightly packed. Service was friendly and efficient.

We ordered Pad Thai with shrimp and Crispy branzino with mango salad. The noodles and shrimp were perfectly cooked. Loved the mango salad. It was delicious and refreshing. However, the branzino fillets were over-fried and very hard instead of being crispy.

Overall, we enjoyed the lunch but would not order crispy dishes again.

The food was absolutely amazing! I ordered the mango sticky rice, salad roll, and pad kee maoâ€”everything was bomb. The flavors were fresh and perfectly balanced. Service was also fantasticâ€”friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Easily one of the best Thai restaurants Iâ€™ve been to. The interior is also beautiful and adds to the overall great experience. Highly recommend!

4.8 out of 5 for a reason, very authentic and I would even say cheap for Manhattan/ upper east side places. We all got the lunch special which was a soup or salad, plus a small app, and a big main dish for 16-21 USD. It is very busy from 12-2 but after 2 is the perfect time it really cleared out. For price and quality this hits the 5/5 category. We waited for our seat at the stumble inn down the road and they had happy hour 4 bucks for draft beer so also super recommended for your stop to wait.

Celebrate a friendâ€™s birthday here and highly recommend making a reservation as it tends to get full quickly! Food was delicious, the service a little slow (likely to it being busy), but overall a great experience. The chairs and tables are a bit close together but that didnâ€™t affect our visit. Definitely stop in!
